ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: The sqldf() function is typically passed a single argument which  is an SQL select statement where the table names are ordinary R data  frame names.  sqldf() transparently sets up a database, imports the  data frames into that database, performs the SQL select or other statement and returns the result using a heuristic to determine which  class to assign to each column of the returned data frame.  The sqldf()  or read.csv.sql() functions can also be used to read filtered files  into R even if the original files are larger than R itself can handle. 'RSQLite', 'RH2', 'RMySQL' and 'RPostgreSQL' backends are supported.

The sqldf() function is typically passed a single argument which  is an SQL select statement where the table names are ordinary R data  frame names.  sqldf() transparently sets up a database, imports the  data frames into that database, performs the SQL select or other statement and returns the result using a heuristic to determine which  class to assign to each column of the returned data frame.  The sqldf()  or read.csv.sql() functions can also be used to read filtered files  into R even if the original files are larger than R itself can handle. 'RSQLite', 'RH2', 'RMySQL' and 'RPostgreSQL' backends are supported.

name: r-sqldf
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.4-12" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-sqldf
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/sqldf_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/sqldf/sqldf_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 954cec7b3ae5f4470ea2bc3df843c25ab53dcfc65e37ba398cd304e42c95fbfa

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-dbi
    - r-rsqlite
    - r-chron
    - r-gsubfn >=0.6
    - r-proto
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-dbi
    - r-rsqlite
    - r-chron
    - r-gsubfn >=0.6
    - r-proto

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('sqldf')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('sqldf')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/ggrothendieck/sqldf, https://groups.google.com/group/sqldf
  license: GPL-2.0-only
  summary: The sqldf() function is typically passed a single argument which  is an SQL select statement where the table names are ordinary R data  frame names.  sqldf() transparently sets up a database, imports the  data frames into that database, performs the SQL select or other statement and returns the result using 
    a heuristic to determine which  class to assign to each column of the returned data frame.  The sqldf()  or read.csv.sql() functions can also be used to read filtered files  into R even if the original files are larger than R itself can handle. 'RSQLite', 'RH2', 'RMySQL' and 'RPostgreSQL' backends are supported.
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file: '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: sqldf
# Version: 0.4-11
# Date: 2017-06-23
# Title: Manipulate R Data Frames Using SQL
# Author: G. Grothendieck <ggrothendieck@gmail.com>
# Maintainer: G. Grothendieck <ggrothendieck@gmail.com>
# Description: The sqldf() function is typically passed a single argument which  is an SQL select statement where the table names are ordinary R data  frame names.  sqldf() transparently sets up a database, imports the  data frames into that database, performs the SQL select or other s$
# ByteCompile: true
# Depends: R (>= 3.1.0), gsubfn (>= 0.6), proto, RSQLite
# Suggests: RH2, RMySQL, RPostgreSQL, svUnit, tcltk, MASS
# Imports: DBI, chron
# License: GPL-2
# BugReports: https://github.com/ggrothendieck/sqldf/issues
# URL: https://github.com/ggrothendieck/sqldf, https://groups.google.com/group/sqldf
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2017-06-28 00:38:13 UTC; Louis
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2017-06-28 06:43:10 UTC
